alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Borden; Dawson; Ector; Gaines; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry; Upton; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 16 at 5:34PM CDT until March 16 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southern Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Glasscock County in western Texas... Andrews County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Dawson County in western Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Northern Reagan County in western Texas... Gaines County in western Texas... Borden County in western Texas... Northern Winkler County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... Northern Upton County in western Texas... * Until 630 PM CDT/530 PM MDT/. * At 532 PM CDT/432 PM MDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Hermleigh to 10 miles north of Midland to 12 miles southeast of Eunice to 19 miles south of Maljamar, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 95 and 228. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Hobbs, Big Spring, Snyder, Andrews, Lovington, Lamesa, Seminole, Colorado City, Eunice, Seagraves, Jal, Ackerly, Greenwood, Gail, Garden City, Stanton, Coahoma and Loraine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Andrews; Borden; Dawson; Ector; Gaines; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry; Upton; Winkler
